articles.headline: Biden Will Choose a New Leader for Bank Regulator With ‘Toxic’ Culture
articles.snippet: Martin Gruenberg, the chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, said he would step down once the Senate confirmed a successor.
articles.abstract: Martin Gruenberg, the chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, said he would step down once the Senate confirmed a successor.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden plans to quickly choose a new leader to oversee the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, a bank regulator rocked by revelations of senior managers’ widespread harassment and abuse of junior employees, a White House official said on Monday.

articles.headline: Aggression or Caution: The Choice Facing Iran’s Next Leaders
articles.snippet: The question is whether the successors to the president and foreign minister will take a similar path by keeping slivers of communication open, and avoiding direct conflict with the United States.
articles.abstract: The question is whether the successors to the president and foreign minister will take a similar path by keeping slivers of communication open, and avoiding direct conflict with the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: In their three years in power, President Ebrahim Raisi of Iran and his equally hard-line foreign minister, Hossein Amir Abdollahian, did everything they could to consolidate the “Axis of Resistance” against the United States and Israel.

articles.headline: Iran Moves to Project Stability After Crash Kills Key Leaders
articles.snippet: The ayatollah announced five days of mourning for the president and foreign minister who died when their helicopter plunged into a mountainous region. Some Iranians celebrated the deaths.
articles.abstract: The ayatollah announced five days of mourning for the president and foreign minister who died when their helicopter plunged into a mountainous region. Some Iranians celebrated the deaths.
articles.lead_paragraph: Iran sought to project a sense of order and control on Monday by quickly naming an acting president and foreign minister a day after a helicopter crash killed both leaders. The change in leadership came at a time of heightened tensions in the Middle East and domestic discontent in Iran, where many residents have called for an end to decades of repressive clerical rule.
articles.byline: By Farnaz Fassihi, Vivian Yee and Leily Nikounazar

articles.headline: Scarlett Johansson Said No, but OpenAI’s Virtual Assistant Sounds Just Like Her
articles.snippet: Last week, the company released a chatbot with an option that sounded like the actress, who provided the voice of an A.I. system in the movie “Her.”
articles.abstract: Last week, the company released a chatbot with an option that sounded like the actress, who provided the voice of an A.I. system in the movie “Her.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Days before OpenAI demonstrated its new, flirty voice assistant last week, the actress Scarlett Johansson said, Sam Altman, the company’s chief executive, called her agent and asked that she consider licensing her voice for a virtual assistant.

articles.headline: Haiti’s Gangs Grow Stronger as Kenyan-Led Force Prepares to Deploy
articles.snippet: Gang leaders with suspected links to the 2021 Haitian president’s assassination now control key infrastructure, and pose a major threat to the incoming Kenya-led force.
articles.abstract: Gang leaders with suspected links to the 2021 Haitian president’s assassination now control key infrastructure, and pose a major threat to the incoming Kenya-led force.
articles.lead_paragraph: They have a stranglehold on the country’s infrastructure, from police stations to seaports. They have chased hundreds of thousands of people from the capital. And they are suspected of having ties to the 2021 assassination of Haiti’s president.

articles.headline: Their Palm Springs Neighborhood Burned More Than 50 Years Ago. They Want Compensation.
articles.snippet: The Black and Latino families of Section 14, who made up much of the labor force of Palm Springs, are asking for reparations for what they say was a racially motivated attack.
articles.abstract: The Black and Latino families of Section 14, who made up much of the labor force of Palm Springs, are asking for reparations for what they say was a racially motivated attack.
articles.lead_paragraph: The billboards rise above the desert valley, introducing millions of visitors to what was an almost forgotten chapter in Palm Springs history. “Know before you go. Palm Springs Section 14,” one billboard reads. “We smelled the smoke, we watched our houses burn.”
articles.byline: By Audra D. S. Burch and Carlos Jaramillo

articles.headline: U.S. Seeks to Join Forces With Europe to Combat Excess Chinese Goods
articles.snippet: Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen warned that China’s industrial strategy posed a global threat that requires a united response.
articles.abstract: Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen warned that China’s industrial strategy posed a global threat that requires a united response.
articles.lead_paragraph: Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen said on Tuesday that the United States and Europe needed to work together to push back against China’s excess industrial capacity, warning that a wave of cheap Chinese exports represents a grave threat to the global economy.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Liz Alderman

articles.headline: I.C.C. Warrant Request Appears to Shore Up Domestic Support for Netanyahu
articles.snippet: “The Hypocrisy of The Hague,” read the front page of one mainstream daily that has often been critical of Israel’s prime minister.
articles.abstract: “The Hypocrisy of The Hague,” read the front page of one mainstream daily that has often been critical of Israel’s prime minister.
articles.lead_paragraph: If the headlines in Israel were anything to go by, the request by the International Criminal Court’s chief prosecutor for an arrest warrant against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu seemed to have granted the Israeli leader one of the most fortuitous turnarounds in his long and turbulent political career.

articles.headline: A.I.’s Black Boxes Just Got a Little Less Mysterious
articles.snippet: Researchers at the A.I. company Anthropic claim to have found clues about the inner workings of large language models, possibly helping to prevent their misuse and to curb their potential threats.
articles.abstract: Researchers at the A.I. company Anthropic claim to have found clues about the inner workings of large language models, possibly helping to prevent their misuse and to curb their potential threats.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the weirder, more unnerving things about today’s leading artificial intelligence systems is that nobody — not even the people who build them — really knows how the systems work.

articles.headline: How Donald Trump’s Financial Future Became Tied to Trump Media
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump has treated Trump Media, which runs his social network Truth Social, as a low-cost sideshow. Now a big portion of his wealth hinges on its success.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump has treated Trump Media, which runs his social network Truth Social, as a low-cost sideshow. Now a big portion of his wealth hinges on its success.
articles.lead_paragraph: At Mar-a-Lago on a Wednesday evening last month, Donald J. Trump mingled with partygoers, greeting his supporters and making small talk. The country star Lee Greenwood sang “God Bless the U.S.A.,” and the former president’s oldest son, Donald Jr., gave a speech.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and David Yaffe-Bellany
